Chapter 15, Part 5: Distinguishing the Great Vehicle, in the first part
How should one know that a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva who has perfected the tenth ground of Dharma clouds is no different from the tathÄgatas?
This bodhisattva-mahÄsattva has already perfected the six perfections, has already perfected the four concentrations,
four immeasurables, and four formless concentrations, has already perfected the four establishments of mindfulness, four right
efforts, four bases of supernatural powers, five faculties, five powers, seven factors of enlightenment, and eightfold noble
path, has already perfected the gate of liberation of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, has already perfected the
five eyes and six supernormal powers, has already perfected the ten powers of a buddha, four fearlessnesses, four
unhindered understandings, great kindness, great compassion, great joy, and great equanimity, and the eighteen distinctiveğŸ”½qualities of a buddha,
the Dharma, omniscience, the cognition of the path, and the cognition of all aspects, have already been perfected,
and if they also permanently eliminate the continuity of the propensities of all afflictions, they will abide in the stage of a buddha.
Therefore, you should know that the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas who have perfected the tenth stage of Dharma Cloud are said to be no different from the tathÄgatas.
At that time, SubhÅ«ti addressed the Buddha, saying:
How do the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas in the tenth stage of Dharma Cloud enter the stage of the tathÄgatas?
This bodhisattva-mahÄsattva skillfully practices the six perfections, cultivates the concentrations,
immeasurable [minds], formless [absorptions], thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, and three gateways to liberation,
and studies the five eyes, six supernormal knowledges, the ten powers of the Buddha, the four fearlessnesses, the four unobstructed [abilities], and the eighteen dharmas exclusive [to the Buddha].
the unobstructed understanding, great kindness, great compassion, great joy, great equanimity, the eighteen distinctive abilities of the Buddha,
all-knowledge, knowledge of the path, and knowledge of all aspects, all the Buddha-dharmas
have already been perfected, therefore, it surpasses the ground of pure view, the ground of the lineage, the eighth ground, the ground of complete seeing,

the ground of thinness, the ground of separation from desire, the ground of accomplishment, the pratyekabuddha ground, and the ten grounds of the bodhisattva, forever severing the continuity of the afflictions and habitual tendencies, and then becoming a TathÄgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One.
In this way, the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva on the tenth ground of Dharma Cloud enters the ground of the TathÄgata.
This is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's setting out in the Great Vehicle.
You asked where this Great Vehicle comes from and where it abides. SubhÅ«ti!

Thus, this Great Vehicle emerges from the three realms and abides in omniscience, because it emerges from omniscience in order to transcend the three realms, but because there is no duality, there is no emergence and no arrival.

Whether it is the Great Vehicle or omniscience, these two dharmas are neither associated nor unassociated, neither with form nor without form, neither visible nor invisible, neither obstructing nor unobstructing, all having the same characteristic, namely, the characteristic of no characteristic. The dharma of no characteristic has no emergence and no arrival.
The dharma of no characteristic is neither already emerged nor already arrived, neither to be emerged nor to be arrived, and neither now emerged nor now arrived.
Those who wish to cause the dharma of no characteristic to have emergence and arrival, then they wish to cause true suchness to have emergence and arrival.
Suchness cannot go out from the three realms, nor can it reach and abide in the cognition of all modes.
Because suchness, the true nature of suchness, is empty by nature.

Those who wish to make the signless dharmas go out and reach, then they would wish to make the dharma realm, dharma nature, non-false nature, unchanging nature, equality nature, birthlessness nature, inconceivable realm, space realm, cutting off realm, separation realm, cessation realm, naturelessness realm, signlessness realm, wishlessness realm, unconditioned realm, peaceful realm, quiescent realm, dharma determination, dharma abiding, original non-existence, and ultimate reality go out and reach.
The dharma realm up to the ultimate reality cannot go out from the three realms, nor can it reach and abide in the cognition of all modes.
because the dharma realm is empty of the intrinsic nature of the dharma realm, up to because the ultimate truth is empty of the intrinsic nature of the ultimate truth.
Those who wish to cause the signless dharmas to have emergence and arrival would be wishing to cause form to have emergence and arrival.
Form cannot emerge from the three realms, nor can it arrive to abide in the cognition of all modes.
It is because form is empty of the intrinsic nature of form.
Those who wish to cause the signless dharmas to have emergence and arrival would be wishing to cause feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness to have emergence and arrival.
Feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness cannot emerge from the three realms, nor can they arrive to abide in the cognition of all modes.
It is because feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are empty of the intrinsic nature of feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness.
Those who wish to cause the dharma of signlessness to emerge and reach somewhere would be wishing to cause the eye sense field to emerge and reach somewhere.
The eye sense field cannot emerge from the three realms, nor can it reach and abide in the cognition of all modes.
The eye sense field, the eye sense field is empty of its own nature.
Those who wish to cause the dharma of signlessness to emerge and reach somewhere would be wishing to cause the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind sense fields to emerge and reach somewhere.
The ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind sense fields cannot emerge from the three realms, nor can they reach and abide in the cognition of all modes.
The ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind sense fields, the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind sense fields are empty of their own nature.
Those who wish to cause the dharma of signlessness to have emergence and arrival would then wish to cause the sphere of form to have emergence and arrival.
The sphere of form cannot emerge from the three realms, nor can it arrive to abide in the cognition of all modes.
It is because the sphere of form, the sphere of form is empty of its own nature.
Those who wish to cause the dharma of signlessness to have emergence and arrival would then wish to cause the spheres of sound, smell, taste, touch, and dharmas to have emergence and arrival.
The spheres of sound, smell, taste, touch, and dharmas cannot emerge from the three realms, nor can they arrive to abide in the cognition of all modes.
It is because the spheres of sound, smell, taste, touch, and dharmas, the spheres of sound, smell, taste, touch, and dharmas are empty of their own nature.
Those who wish to cause the dharma of signlessness to emerge and reach somewhere would then wish to cause the eye-element to emerge and reach somewhere.
The eye-element cannot emerge from the three realms, nor can it reach and abide in the cognition of all modes.
The eye-element is empty of the intrinsic nature of the eye-element.

Those who wish to cause the dharma of signlessness to emerge and reach somewhere would then wish to cause the form-element, eye-consciousness-element, eye-contact, and the feelings produced by eye-contact as a condition to emerge and reach somewhere.
The form-element up to the feelings produced by eye-contact as a condition cannot emerge from the three realms, nor can it reach and abide in the cognition of all modes.

The form-element is empty of the intrinsic nature of the form-element, up to the feelings produced by eye-contact as a condition are empty of the intrinsic nature of the feelings produced by eye-contact as a condition.
Those who wish to cause the signless Dharma to have emergence and arrival are then wishing to cause the ear-sphere to have emergence and arrival.
The ear-sphere is unable to emerge from the three realms, and is also unable to arrive and abide in the cognition of all modes.
It is because the ear-sphere, the ear-sphere itself is empty of inherent nature.

Those who wish to cause the signless Dharma to have emergence and arrival are then wishing to cause the sound-sphere, ear-consciousness-sphere, and the ear-contact, and the feelings produced by the condition of ear-contact to have emergence and arrival.
The sound-sphere up to the feelings produced by the condition of ear-contact are unable to emerge from the three realms, and are also unable to arrive and abide in the cognition of all modes.
It is because the sound-sphere, the sound-sphere itself is empty, up to the feelings produced by the condition of ear-contact, the feelings produced by the condition of ear-contact itself is empty.
Those who wish to cause the signless Dharma to have emergence and arrival are then wishing to cause the nose-faculty to have emergence and arrival.
The nose-faculty is unable to emerge from the three realms, and is also unable to arrive and abide in the cognition of all modes.
The nose-faculty is empty of the intrinsic nature of the nose-faculty.

Those who wish to cause the signless Dharma to have emergence and arrival are then wishing to cause the olfactory-sphere, nose-consciousness-sphere, and nose-contact, as well as the various feelings produced with nose-contact as condition to have emergence and arrival.

The olfactory-sphere up to nose-contact as condition for the production of various feelings are unable to emerge from the three realms, and are also unable to arrive and abide in the cognition of all modes.

the olfactory sphere is empty of the nature of the olfactory sphere, and so on up to: nose contact and what is born from nose contact as a condition are empty of the nature of nose contact and what is born from nose contact as a condition.
Those who want to make a signless dharma come out and go somewhere, then they want to make the tongue sense base come out and go somewhere.
The tongue sense base cannot come out from the three realms, and also cannot reach and abide in the cognition of all modes.
The tongue sense base is empty of the nature of the tongue sense base.

Those who want to make a signless dharma come out and go somewhere, then they want to make the taste sense base, the tongue cognition sense base, and tongue contact and what is born from tongue contact as a condition come out and go somewhere.
The taste sense base up to tongue contact and what is born from tongue contact as a condition cannot come out from the three realms, and also cannot reach and abide in the cognition of all modes.

Because the taste element and the taste element are empty of their own nature, up to the tactile objects and the tactile consciousness element and the tactile contact and the tactile contact that gives rise to feelings are empty of their own nature.
Those who wish to cause the signless Dharma to have emergence and arrival are then wishing to cause the body element to have emergence and arrival.
Because the body element cannot emerge from the three realms, and also cannot arrive to abide in the cognition of all modes.
Because the body element and the body element are empty of their own nature.

Those who wish to cause the signless Dharma to have emergence and arrival are then wishing to cause the tactile objects and the tactile consciousness element and the tactile contact and the tactile contact that gives rise to feelings to have emergence and arrival.
Because the tactile objects up to the tactile contact that gives rise to feelings cannot emerge from the three realms, and also cannot arrive to abide in the cognition of all modes.

The sphere of touch, the sphere of touch is empty by its very nature, up to the various feelings that arise from the condition of body-contact, the various feelings that arise from the condition of body-contact are empty by their very nature.
Those who wish to cause the signless Dharma to have emergence and arrival, then they would wish to cause the mind-sphere to have emergence and arrival.
The mind-sphere is unable to emerge from the three realms, and is also unable to arrive and abide in the cognition of all modes.
The mind-sphere, the mind-sphere is empty by its very nature.

Those who wish to cause the signless Dharma to have emergence and arrival, then they would wish to cause the dharma-sphere, the mind-consciousness-sphere, and the mind-contact, the various feelings that arise from the condition of mind-contact to have emergence and arrival.
The dharma realm up to the mental contact that gives rise to feelings from conditions cannot emerge from the three realms, nor can it reach and abide in the cognition of all modes.

It is because the dharma realm is empty of the intrinsic nature of the dharma realm, up to the mental contact that gives rise to feelings from conditions is empty of the intrinsic nature of the mental contact that gives rise to feelings from conditions.
Those who wish to cause the signless dharmas to emerge and reach would then wish to cause the earth element to emerge and reach.
The earth element cannot emerge from the three realms, nor can it reach and abide in the cognition of all modes.
It is because the earth element is empty of the intrinsic nature of the earth element.
Those who wish to cause the signless dharmas to emerge and reach would then wish to cause the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements to emerge and reach.
The elements of water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness cannot emerge from the three realms, nor can they reach and abide in the cognition of all knowledge.
It is because the elements of water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness are empty of their own intrinsic nature.
Those who wish to make the signless dharmas have emergence and arrival are then wishing to make the noble truth of suffering have emergence and arrival.
The noble truth of suffering cannot emerge from the three realms, nor can it reach and abide in the cognition of all knowledge.
It is because the noble truth of suffering is empty of its own intrinsic nature.
Those who wish to make the signless dharmas have emergence and arrival are then wishing to make the noble truths of accumulation, cessation, and the path have emergence and arrival.
The noble truths of accumulation, cessation, and path cannot emerge from the three realms, nor can they reach and abide in the cognition of all modes.
Because the noble truths of accumulation, cessation, and path are empty of the intrinsic nature of the noble truths of accumulation, cessation, and path.
Those who wish to cause signless dharmas to emerge and reach would then wish to cause ignorance to emerge and reach.
Ignorance cannot emerge from the three realms, nor can it reach and abide in the cognition of all modes.
Because ignorance is empty of the intrinsic nature of ignorance.

Those who wish to cause signless dharmas to emerge and reach would then wish to cause karmic formations, consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, becoming, birth, aging and death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, distress, and anguish to emerge and reach.
up to old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, and distress cannot leave the three realms and cannot reach and abide in the cognition of all modes.
Because the nature of going is empty, up to the nature of old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, and distress is empty.
Those who want to make the signless dharmas have emergence and arrival are the same as wanting to make an illusion have emergence and arrival.
Because an illusion cannot leave the three realms and cannot reach and abide in the cognition of all modes.
Because the nature of an illusion is empty.

Those who want to make the signless dharmas have emergence and arrival are the same as wanting to make dream objects, reflections, echoes, light and shadow, empty flowers, mirages, cities of fragrance-eaters, and magical creations have emergence and arrival.
Because dream objects up to magical creations cannot emerge from the three realms, nor can they reach and abide in the cognition of all modes.
Because dream objects are empty of the intrinsic nature of dream objects, up to magical creations are empty of the intrinsic nature of magical creations.
Those who wish to make the signless dharmas emerge and reach would be wishing to make internal emptiness emerge and reach.
Because internal emptiness cannot emerge from the three realms, nor can it reach and abide in the cognition of all modes.
Because internal emptiness is empty of the intrinsic nature of internal emptiness.

Those who wish to make the signless dharmas have emergence and arrival would be wishing to make external emptiness, internal and external emptiness, emptiness of emptiness, great emptiness, ultimate emptiness, emptiness of conditioned phenomena, emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, absolute emptiness, emptiness without beginning or end, emptiness of dispersion, emptiness of unchanging, emptiness of inherent nature, emptiness of specific characteristics, emptiness of common characteristics, emptiness of all dharmas, emptiness of non-attainment, emptiness of nature, emptiness of self-nature, and emptiness of the nature of self-nature have emergence and arrival.
External emptiness up to the emptiness of the nature of self-nature cannot emerge from the three realms, nor can it arrive to abide in the cognition of all knowledge.
External emptiness is empty of the nature of external emptiness, up to the emptiness of the nature of self-nature is empty of the nature of the emptiness of the nature of self-nature.
Those who wish to cause the dharma of signlessness to emerge and reach somewhere would be wishing to cause the perfection of giving to emerge and reach somewhere.
The perfection of giving cannot emerge from the three realms, nor can it reach and abide in the cognition of all modes.
It is because the perfection of giving is empty of the intrinsic nature of the perfection of giving.

Those who wish to cause the dharma of signlessness to emerge and reach somewhere would be wishing to cause the perfections of morality, patience, vigor, meditation, and wisdom to emerge and reach somewhere.
The perfections of morality, patience, vigor, meditation, and wisdom cannot emerge from the three realms, nor can they reach and abide in the cognition of all modes.
the purity of morality, patience, perseverance, concentration, and wisdom, the purity of morality, patience, perseverance, concentration, and wisdom are empty of inherent nature.
Those who wish to cause the signless Dharma to have emergence and arrival are then wishing to cause the four concentrations to have emergence and arrival.
The four concentrations are unable to emerge from the three realms, and are also unable to arrive and abide in omniscience.
The four concentrations, the four concentrations are empty of inherent nature.
Those who wish to cause the signless Dharma to have emergence and arrival are then wishing to cause the four immeasurables and four formless concentrations to have emergence and arrival.
The four immeasurables and four formless concentrations are unable to emerge from the three realms, and are also unable to arrive and abide in omniscience.
The four immeasurables and four formless concentrations are empty of the intrinsic nature of the four immeasurables and four formless concentrations.
Those who wish to cause the dharma of signlessness to have emergence and arrival would cause the four establishments of mindfulness to have emergence and arrival.
The four establishments of mindfulness cannot emerge from the three realms, nor can they arrive to abide in omniscience.
The four establishments of mindfulness are empty of the intrinsic nature of the four establishments of mindfulness.

Those who wish to cause the dharma of signlessness to have emergence and arrival would cause the four right efforts, four bases of supernatural power, five faculties, five powers, seven factors of enlightenment, and eightfold noble path to have emergence and arrival.
The four right efforts up to the eightfold noble path cannot emerge from the three realms, nor can they arrive to abide in omniscience.
The four right efforts are empty of the nature of the four right efforts, up to the eightfold noble path is empty of the nature of the eightfold noble path.
Those who wish to cause the signless Dharma to have emergence and arrival are then wishing to cause the emptiness liberation gate to have emergence and arrival.
The emptiness liberation gate cannot emerge from the three realms, nor can it arrive to abide in omniscience.
The emptiness liberation gate is empty of the nature of the emptiness liberation gate.
Those who wish to cause the signless Dharma to have emergence and arrival are then wishing to cause the signless and wishless liberation gates to have emergence and arrival.
The signless and wishless liberation gates cannot emerge from the three realms, nor can they arrive to abide in omniscience.
The doors of liberation of signlessness and wishlessness are empty of the intrinsic nature of the doors of liberation of signlessness and wishlessness.
Those who wish to cause signless dharmas to have emergence and arrival are then wishing to cause the five eyes to have emergence and arrival.
The five eyes cannot emerge from the three realms, nor can they arrive to abide in omniscience.
The five eyes are empty of the intrinsic nature of the five eyes.
Those who wish to cause signless dharmas to have emergence and arrival are then wishing to cause the six supernormal knowledges to have emergence and arrival.
The six supernormal knowledges cannot emerge from the three realms, nor can they arrive to abide in omniscience.
The six supernormal knowledges are empty of the intrinsic nature of the six supernormal knowledges.
Those who wish to cause the dharma of signlessness to emerge and reach somewhere would then wish to cause the ten powers of the Buddha to emerge and reach somewhere.
The ten powers of the Buddha cannot emerge from the three realms, nor can they reach and abide in the cognition of all modes.
It is because the intrinsic nature of the ten powers of the Buddha is empty.

Those who wish to cause the dharma of signlessness to emerge and reach somewhere would then wish to cause the four forms of fearlessness, the four unobstructed understandings, great loving kindness, great compassion, great joy, great equanimity, the eighteen distinctive abilities of the Buddha, omniscience, cognition of the path, and cognition of all aspects to emerge and reach somewhere.
The four forms of fearlessness up to the cognition of all aspects cannot emerge from the three realms, nor can they reach and abide in the cognition of all modes.
The four fearlessnesses are empty of the nature of the four fearlessnesses, up to all wisdom is empty of the nature of all wisdom.
Those who want to make the signless dharmas have emergence and arrival are then making the stream-enterers' bad destinies and births have emergence and arrival.
The stream-enterers' bad destinies and births cannot emerge from the three realms, and also cannot arrive to abide in the cognition of all wisdom.
The stream-enterers' bad destinies and births are empty of the nature of the stream-enterers' bad destinies and births.

Those who want to make the signless dharmas have emergence and arrival are then making the once-returners' frequent births, the non-returners' desire realm births, the great beings' self-beneficial births, the arhats, pratyekabuddhas, and the tathÄgatas' subsequent births have emergence and arrival.
The once-returner's frequent rebirth, up to the fully enlightened Buddha's subsequent existence, cannot emerge from the three realms, nor can they reach and abide in the cognition of all modes.

The once-returner's frequent rebirth is empty of the intrinsic nature of the once-returner's frequent rebirth, up to the fully enlightened Buddha's subsequent existence is empty of the intrinsic nature of the fully enlightened Buddha's subsequent existence.
Those who wish to make the signless dharmas emerge and reach, then they wish to make the approacher to the fruit of stream-entry and the fruit of stream-entry emerge and reach.
The approacher to the fruit of stream-entry and the fruit of stream-entry cannot emerge from the three realms, nor can they reach and abide in the cognition of all modes.
The approacher to the fruit of stream-entry and the fruit of stream-entry are empty of the intrinsic nature of the approacher to the fruit of stream-entry and the fruit of stream-entry.

If one wishes to make the dharma of signlessness have emergence and arrival, then one would wish to make the approach to once-returning and the fruit of once-returning, the approach to non-returning and the fruit of non-returning, the approach to arhatship and the fruit of arhatship, the approach to individual enlightenment and the fruit of individual enlightenment, and the bodhisattva and tathÄgata have emergence and arrival.
The approach to once-returning and the fruit of once-returning, up to the tathÄgata, cannot emerge from the three realms, and also cannot arrive to abide in the cognition of all modes.
The approach to once-returning and the fruit of once-returning, up to the tathÄgata, are empty of their own intrinsic nature.
If one wishes to make the dharma of signlessness have emergence and arrival, then one would wish to make names, conceptual thoughts, designations, and expressions have emergence and arrival.

Names, conceptual thoughts, designations, and expressions cannot emerge from the three realms, nor can they reach and abide in the cognition of all modes.
Because the intrinsic nature of names, conceptual thoughts, designations, and expressions is empty.

Those who wish to make the signless dharmas emerge and reach somewhere, then they would wish to make the unborn, unceasing, unstained, unpurified, signless, and unconditioned dharmas emerge and reach somewhere.
The unborn, unceasing, unstained, unpurified, signless, and unconditioned dharmas cannot emerge from the three realms, nor can they reach and abide in the cognition of all modes.
Because the intrinsic nature of the unborn, unceasing, unstained, unpurified, signless, and unconditioned dharmas is empty.

For this reason, this Great Vehicle departs from the three realms and arrives at the abode of omniscience, because of non-duality there is no departure and no arrival, because a dharma without characteristics has no movement or change.
You ask, 'In what does this Great Vehicle abide?' SubhÅ«ti!
This Great Vehicle does not abide anywhere.
Because all dharmas do not abide anywhere.
Because the abode of dharmas cannot be apprehended.
However, this Great Vehicle abides in non-abiding.
Just as the nature of suchness does not abide and does not not abide, the Great Vehicle is also like this, not abiding and not not abiding.
Because the nature of suchness has no abiding and no not abiding.
The suchness of dharmas is empty of the suchness of dharmas.

Just as the dharma realm, dharma nature, non-false nature, unchanging nature, equality nature, birthlessness nature, inconceivable realm, space realm, cutting off realm, separation realm, cessation realm, naturelessness realm, signlessness realm, wishless realm, unconditioned realm, peaceful realm, quiescent realm, dharma determination, dharma abiding, original non-existence, and actual reality nature are neither abiding nor non-abiding, the Great Vehicle is also like this, neither abiding nor non-abiding.
Because the nature of the dharma realm and so forth up to the nature of actual reality are neither abiding nor non-abiding.
Because the nature of the dharma realm is empty of the nature of the dharma realm, and so forth up to the nature of actual reality being empty of the nature of actual reality.

because the nature of form is empty of the nature of form.

because the nature of the sound, smell, taste, touch, and dharma sense fields is empty of the nature of the sound, smell, taste, touch, and dharma sense fields.

Just as the nature of the four fearlessnesses, four unobstructed understandings, great kindness, great compassion, great joy, great equanimity, eighteen distinctive abilities of a Buddha, omniscience, knowledge of the aspects of the path, and knowledge of all aspects is neither abiding nor non-abiding, the Great Vehicle is also like this, neither abiding nor non-abiding.

Just as the nature of frequent rebirth of a once-returner, rebirth in the desire realm of a non-returner, rebirth for one's own benefit of a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, rebirth of an arhat, pratyekabuddha, and perfectly enlightened one is neither abiding nor non-abiding, so too is the Great Vehicle neither abiding nor non-abiding.

Just as non-arising, non-cessation, non-defilement, non-purification, signlessness, and the unconditioned nature are neither abiding nor non-abiding, the Great Vehicle is also like this, neither abiding nor non-abiding.

For this reason, this Great Vehicle, although it does not abide anywhere, abides in non-abiding.
You asked, 'Who rides in this Great Vehicle and emerges?' SubhÅ«ti!
There is no one who rides the Great Vehicle to come out.

Whether it is the vehicle that is ridden, the one who rides it, the purpose of riding it, the place of departure, the destination, or the time of departure and arrival, all of these are non-existent and cannot be apprehended.

Because all dharmas are non-existent and cannot be apprehended, because they are ultimately pure, how can one say there is a vehicle, a rider, a purpose, a place of departure, a destination, or a time of departure and arrival?
Because the self is non-existent and cannot be apprehended, one who rides the Great Vehicle can also not be apprehended.

Thus, sentient beings, living beings, born beings, nourished beings, persons, pudgalas, mind-born, young men, agents, instigators, risers, instigators of rising, feelers, instigators of feeling, knowers, and seers are non-existent and cannot be apprehended, and therefore one riding the Great Vehicle can also not be apprehended.
Because suchness is non-existent and cannot be apprehended, one riding the Great Vehicle can also not be apprehended.

Thus, the dharma realm, dharma nature, non-false nature, unchanging nature, equality nature, separation nature, inconceivable realm, space realm, cutting off realm, separation realm, cessation realm, natureless realm, signless realm, wishless realm, unconditioned realm, peaceful realm, quiescent realm, dharma determination, dharma abiding, original non-existence, and actual reality are all non-existent and cannot be attained, and therefore those who ride the Great Vehicle cannot be attained either.
Because form is non-existent and cannot be attained, those who ride the Great Vehicle cannot be attained either.
Thus, because feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are non-existent and cannot be attained, those who ride the Great Vehicle cannot be attained either.
Because the eye sense field has no existence and cannot be apprehended, one who rides the Great Vehicle cannot be apprehended either.
Because the ear, nose, tongue, body, and thinking-mind sense fields have no existence and cannot be apprehended, one who rides the Great Vehicle cannot be apprehended either.
Because the form sense field has no existence and cannot be apprehended, one who rides the Great Vehicle cannot be apprehended either.
Because the sound, smell, taste, touch, and dharma sense fields have no existence and cannot be apprehended, one who rides the Great Vehicle cannot be apprehended either.
Because the eye constituent has no existence and cannot be apprehended, one who rides the Great Vehicle cannot be apprehended either.

In this way, the form realm, eye consciousness realm, eye contact, and the feelings produced by eye contact as a condition are non-existent and cannot be attained, so one who rides the Great Vehicle cannot be attained either.
The ear realm is non-existent and cannot be attained, so one who rides the Great Vehicle cannot be attained either.

In this way, the sound realm, ear consciousness realm, ear contact, and the feelings produced by ear contact as a condition are non-existent and cannot be attained, so one who rides the Great Vehicle cannot be attained either.
The nose realm is non-existent and cannot be attained, so one who rides the Great Vehicle cannot be attained either.

Thus, the realm of smells, the nose consciousness, and nose contact, and the various feelings produced by nose contact as a condition, are non-existent and cannot be attained, and therefore one who rides the Great Vehicle cannot be attained either.
The realm of the tongue is non-existent and cannot be attained, and therefore one who rides the Great Vehicle cannot be attained either.

Thus, the realm of tastes, the tongue consciousness, and tongue contact, and the various feelings produced by tongue contact as a condition, are non-existent and cannot be attained, and therefore one who rides the Great Vehicle cannot be attained either.
The realm of the body is non-existent and cannot be attained, and therefore one who rides the Great Vehicle cannot be attained either.

In this way, because the sphere of touch, the body consciousness element, body contact, and the feelings produced from body contact as a condition have no existence and cannot be apprehended, one who rides the Great Vehicle can also not be apprehended.
Because the mind element has no existence and cannot be apprehended, one who rides the Great Vehicle can also not be apprehended.

In this way, because the dharma element, mind consciousness element, mind contact, and the feelings produced from mind contact as a condition have no existence and cannot be apprehended, one who rides the Great Vehicle can also not be apprehended.
